title: Alaska Native community relocates as climate crisis ravages homes
description: The town of Newtok is one of the first communities in the US to collectively move because of the climate crisis.

title: US House approves referendum on Puerto Rico’s future
description: Bill, unlikely to pass in the Senate, would offer Puerto Rico voters choice between statehood and forms of independence.

title: US lawmakers mull restrictions on TikTok over security concerns
description: US lawmakers have voiced concern that user data could be accessed by the Chinese government.

title: US jury convicts Texas police officer in fatal home shooting
description: A jury found Aaron Dean guilty of manslaughter in the death of Atatiana Jefferson, killed during a police welfare check.

title: Photos: Bethlehem welcomes Christmas tourists after pandemic lull
description: Although tourism hasn't fully recovered, the hordes of visitors are an encouraging sign, business owners say.

title: Slovakia’s government loses parliamentary no-confidence vote
description: Fall of coalition government is latest stage of ongoing political crisis and could pave way for early elections.

title: Ukrainian general says Russia preparing for ‘prolonged’ war
description: Comments come as Russia pounded Kherson city and Kharkiv, while Ukraine shelled Donetsk in the east.

title: Photos: Judge to rule on Castillo’s detention amid Peru protests
description: Demonstrations held in support of ousted president across the country as his successor, Dina Boluarte, pleads for calm.

title: Biden backs African Union becoming permanent G20 member
description: US also pledges $165m to help support elections and good governance as African nations prepare to hold votes next year.

title: UK launches probe into claims its troops killed Afghan civilians
description: The independent probe will look into allegations that British special forces killed dozens of Afghan civilians.

title: In a first, US watchdog gets full access to audit Chinese firms
description: It marks a victory for US regulators and a relief for Chinese firms like Alibaba that faced delisting from US exchanges.

title: What impact does China’s economy have on the rest of the world?
description: Latest economic data from China paints a gloomier picture than analysts had forecast.

title: Air pollution blights India’s capital
description: A toxic haze hangs heavily over north India each year as winter sets in, affecting the health of millions of people.

title: Thousands protest against conviction of Istanbul Mayor Imamoglu
description: Supporters of Ekrem Imamoglu rally in Istanbul after a court sentenced the mayor to prison and banned him from politics.

title: India test-fires Agni-V missile amid border tensions with China
description: The nuclear-capable missile, with a range of 5,400km (3,300 miles) fired from Odisha state, a government minister says.

title: Three US men sentenced for plan to kidnap Michigan governor
description: Two ringleaders in the alleged kidnapping plot are also expected to receive sentences before the end of the month.

title: ICC upholds sentence of Uganda child soldier turned LRA commander
description: Judges ruled that Ongwen was not under duress and acted independently at the time when he had committed the crimes.

title: US sees biggest drop in retail sales in 11 months
description: Drop indicates higher borrowing costs and the threat of an imminent recession were starting to impact spending.

title: There’s a mega climate problem with our megacities | All Hail
description: Greening our cities makes them more liveable and more sustainable, but is this coming at too high a cost for some?

title: Boris Becker departs for Germany after UK prison term
description: The 55-year-old German six-time Grand Slam champion has served a prison sentence linked to his 2017 bankruptcy.

title: Civilians wounded as fighting erupts at Pakistan-Afghan border
description: At least 16 Pakistanis injured in Chaman, medical official says, as border forces clash for second time in a week.

title: MPs seek answers from UK gov’t about Rapid Action Battalion trips
description: Call for 'clear answers' comes after Al Jazeera revealed notorious Bangladeshi unit travelled to UK for spy training.

title: Julius Hirsch: The German ‘national hero’ killed by the Nazis
description: Only the second Jew to play for Germany, Hirsch broke records and fought in WWI for a country that would kill him.

title: Bank of England hikes interest rate to 14-year high
description: The central bank's interest rate hike to 3.5 percent, the ninth rise in a row, aims to cool sky-high inflation.

title: Middle East round-up: Public hanging in Iran seen as message
description: Here’s a round-up of Al Jazeera’s Middle East coverage this week.

title: Why is Africa turning away from the United States?
description: Former African Union diplomat Arikana Chihombori-Quao doesn’t see much hope for this week's US-Africa Leaders Summit.

title: Tensions in north Kosovo – whose agenda does the flare-up serve?
description: Ethnic fractures in the Western Balkans, including in Kosovo's Serb-populated area, create trouble for the EU and US.

title: El Arena: The Middle East’s underground battle rap competition
description: As Beirut plunges into crisis, battle rappers from across the Arab world fight to keep their battle rap league alive.

title: Mbappe tells Hakimi: ‘You made history’ at the World Cup
description: After France dashed Morocco's hopes in Wednesday's semifinal, the friends swapped shirts, hugs and respect.

title: Southeast Asia’s Female Fighters
description: 101 East investigates the rise of female fighters in armed groups across Southeast Asia.

title: Up to 100,000 nurses stage ‘last resort’ strike in UK over pay
description: The Royal College of Nursing members' walkout is part of a growing wave of stoppages by public and private sector staff.

title: Ex-Tunisian president warns of ‘Arab volcano’ ahead of elections
description: Former Tunisian President Moncef Marzouki tells Al Jazeera current President Kais Saied is part of 'counter-revolution'.

title: What can the Patriot missile do for Ukraine?
description: US has agreed to send a Patriot missile battery to Ukraine, but experts say it may not be a game changer in the war.

title: Ebola vaccines produced lasting antibodies during trial: Studies
description: Studies in West Africa said the vaccines developed by Johnson & Johnson and Merck & Co appear to be safe in children.

title: At least 31 dead in India’s Bihar after drinking toxic alcohol
description: Deaths happened mainly in two villages in impoverished state, where sale and consumption of liquor were banned in 2016.

title: At least three people killed in Louisiana as winter storm hits US
description: A mother and her eight-year-old child killed in US state of Louisiana and several others injured amid heavy storms.

title: WHO chief says uncle was ‘murdered’ by Eritrean troops in Tigray
description: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus is a former Ethiopian minister from Tigray who has been a vocal critic of the conflict.

title: Irish soldier killed after UN convoy attacked in Lebanon
description: The Irish soldier was serving on a peacekeeping mission when the convoy came under small arms fire.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 295
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 295th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: China’s retail, factory output slump as COVID curbs hit growth
description: Factory output and retail sales missed forecasts in November amid lockdowns and weakening global demand.

title: Dozens freed in new Ukraine-Russia prisoner swap
description: Latest exchange suggests some contact remains between two sides despite intense fighting in Ukraine's east and south.

title: Australia accuses Apple, Microsoft of overlooking child sex abuse
description: Internet safety watchdog says tech giants should automatically scan for child exploitation material on their services.

title: Fiji’s opposition to challenge election results
description: Move comes after Fiji authorities took down a provisional tally that showed the opposition holding a very early lead.

title: Taiwanese train for war after year of crises
description: As tensions rise in the Taiwan Strait, private companies are stepping forward to prepare Taiwanese civilians for war.

title: United Nations blocks Myanmar military taking UN seat
description: Rights groups say the National Unity Government, made up of elected members, must represent Myanmar at all UN bodies.
